title.rendered: Canada Targeted Express Entry Draw for Healthcare Workers ~ 1500 Invitations

Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]On July 6, 2023, IRCC held the third Category-Based Express Entry Draw targeted for Healthcare professionals. A total of 1,500 candidates as per the announcement made on June 28, 2023. The minimum CRS score required was 463, which is so far the lowest CRS score observed in 2023. Earlier this week, IRCC invited 500 candidates in Targeted Express Entry Draw for the STEM category.

Targeted Express Entry Draw July 6, 2023 Results:

  • Express Entry Round: #255
  • Draw Type: Occupation-Based Targeted
  • Draw Date:  July 6, 2023
  • CRS Cut-off Score: 463
  • No. of invitations: 15,00
  • Tie-breaking rule: June 19, 2023
[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” centered_text=”true” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Start Express Entry Assessment Now” url=”https://bit.ly/start-free-assessment”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry Draw for 35 Eligibile Healthcare Occupations

Healthcare professions are prominently featured on Canada’s Targeted Express Entry Occupation List, comprising a total of 35 occupations. The country is actively seeking skilled individuals, including dentists, registered nurses, psychologists, and physiotherapists, to address the pressing shortage of healthcare workers. This scarcity is a result of Canada’s declining birth rate and aging population, emphasizing the urgent need for skilled immigrants to fill these crucial roles.

Check the detailed NOC TEER codes eligible for targeted Express Entry Draws under the Healthcare occupations below:

Skilled Newcomers’ Intended Health Occupations in Canada (2017-2022)

Based on preliminary estimates from IRCC landing data, skilled newcomers who arrived in Canada between 2017 and 2022 expressed their intention to work in the following health occupations:

Occupation Number of Skilled Newcomers
Nurses 10,051
– Registered Nurses
– Licensed Practical Nurses
– Registered Psychiatric Nurses
Doctors 4,449
– Specialist Physicians 2,013
Dentists 2,552
Pharmacists 2,054
Physiotherapists 798
Occupational Therapists 112
Optometrists 156
Dietitians and Nutritionists 218
Chiropractors 13
Medical Laboratory Technologists 410
Medical Radiation Technologists 222
Audiologists and Speech-Language Pathologists 151
Allied Primary Health Practitioners 171
Paramedical Occupations 56
Respiratory Therapists, Clinical Perfusionists, and Cardiopulmonary Technologists 88
Dental Hygienists and Dental Therapists 155

Apart from the Healthcare category, IRCC holds Targeted Express Entry Draws for the candidates having the criteria mentioned below:

  • French-language proficiency
  • Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) occupations
  • Skilled Trade occupations
  • Transport occupations (including Truck Drivers)
  • Agriculture and agri-food occupations

You must also meet all the eligibility requirements for one of the three economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/blog/targeted-express-entry-for-nurses/[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Need Help with Your Canadian Immigration Journey?

If you’re a healthcare professional or a STEM expert aspiring for a fulfilling career and life in Canada, this is the perfect opportunity to make your move. Canada is actively seeking skilled individuals like you to join its thriving healthcare sector. We are here to provide you with expert guidance and support to help you realize your dreams of living and working in Canada. Get ready for an exciting journey towards a brighter future!

Introducing Mr. Keshav Sharma, a highly qualified Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) with specialized knowledge in healthcare and STEM occupations.

For a limited time, eligible healthcare and STEM candidates can take advantage of our comprehensive services starting at just CAD $999. Here’s what our tailored package includes:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Take the first step towards transforming your aspiration of living and working in Canada into a reality by contacting us here or scheduling a consultation with us today.

Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting opportunity, and get ready to embark on a new chapter in your professional life.
